long: Meaning: properly, to "flow" as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to "lay" or "throw" (especially an arrow, i.e. to "shoot"); figuratively, to "point" out (as if by "aiming" the finger), to "teach".  Usage: ( ) archer, cast, direct, inform, instruct, lay, shew, shoot, teach(-er,-ing), through.  Source: or (2 Chronicles 26:15) "יָרָא"; a primitive root;
